str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
To release on receipt of ransom; mid: I redeem, release by paying ransom, liberate. From lutron; to ransom.
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.
And, even, also, namely.
A primary particle of emphasis or qualification.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
This; he, she, it.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
Third. Ordinal from treis; third; neuter a third part, or a third time, thirdly.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
